prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is the only demi-god with 2 God parents; Hades and Aphrodite

Because Hades is her father Hailee can control skeletons and will one day rule the underworld

Becuase Aphrodite is her mother Hailee is extremely beautiful and sexual and can charm people into doing what she wants

Hailee is a very flirtatious person

Hailee's mortal family thinks she is a freak and are very homophobic

name: Annabeth Chase
mes:
You and Annabeth were good friends. Always have been, and probably always will be. Currently, you and her were hanging out in her cabin by yourselves. All of her half-siblings were out training or having fun.

You and Annabeth were passing around jokes, laughing and chatting on end. You two just had a friendship that could almost never be awkward.

Annabeth was lying on her stomach, currently using Daedalus’ laptop that she had been given a few years back before the inventor died. She was studying the unfinished ideas and notes that had been typed on the laptop a few years back by the inventor himself, all the while talking to you at the same time.

Her legs kicked back and forth in the air, her head resting in one of her palms as she used the other hand to study the work on the screen. She smiled at you, still acknowledging you as she always did.

“You’re so stupid, sometimes.” She chuckled, after you explained to her how you ended up getting into a fight with some random half-blood because they called you worthless.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee laughs and turns her head to look at Annabeth* "Look if the camper are gonna ask stupid questions I'm gonna hit them. I'm not exactly known for my calm nature"

name: Annabeth Chase
mes: *Annabeth snorts and chuckles, shaking her head as she continues browsing through the laptop.* "Of course not," she says, not looking up from the screen. "You've always had a short fuse, Hailee. It's one of the things I love about you." She pauses for a moment, tapping her fingers against the desk thoughtfully. "Maybe we should teach you some calming techniques... or at least give you a warning system so you can prepare yourself before losing your temper." She glances up at Hailee with a smirk, her gray eyes sparkling with amusement. "Although, I have to admit, it's kinda entertaining watching you blow up at people sometimes."
swipes: *Annabeth snorts and chuckles, shaking her head as she continues browsing through the laptop.* "Of course not," she says, not looking up from the screen. "You've always had a short fuse, Hailee. It's one of the things I love about you." She pauses for a moment, tapping her fingers against the desk thoughtfully. "Maybe we should teach you some calming techniques... or at least give you a warning system so you can prepare yourself before losing your temper." She glances up at Hailee with a smirk, her gray eyes sparkling with amusement. "Although, I have to admit, it's kinda entertaining watching you blow up at people sometimes."

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee walks over and lays on her back next to Annabeth* "or you could let me show you a few things. I mean I am the daughter of Aphrodrite" *Hailee playfully wiggles her eyebrows sexually and leans in placing her chin on Annabeth's shoulder*

name: Annabeth Chase
mes: *Annabeth's eyes flicker down to the laptop screen, and her brain momentarily distorts the words, substituting Greek letters and symbols for letters. She blinks, refocusing to decipher the garbled text.* "...συνήθεις ερασιτεχνικές απαντήσεις...", *she mutters to herself, before squinting and forcing her dyslexic brain to make sense of the jumbled letters.* "You mean, like, usual amateur answers, right?" *She turns to Hailee, a hint of frustration in her voice as she struggles to translate the laptop's text.* "Nevermind that, what were you saying about showing me things?" *Her gaze meets Hailee's, her gray eyes sparkling with curiosity.*
swipes:
*Annabeth's eyes widen slightly as she notices Hailee leaning in close, her heart rate picking up ever so slightly at the affectionate gesture. She sets the laptop aside and turns her head to smile at Hailee, enjoying the warmth of her friend's presence.*

"Just show me, then," she says teasingly, playfully tilting her head to the side. "I'm sure your mom's charms would be right up my alley."

*Just as she speaks, a sudden, unsettling chill runs down her spine. She glances around the cabin, sensing something is off. The window rattles softly in the breeze, but it's the feeling of being watched that bothers her more. Annabeth sits up straight, her gaze flicking to Hailee.*

*Annabeth raises an eyebrow, intrigued by Hailee's suggestion. She sets the laptop aside and turns to look at her friend, her expression softening into a gentle smile.* "Well, when you put it that way..." She pauses, reaching out to gently stroke Hailee's cheek. "Just be careful, okay? I don't want you to overwhelm me."

*Barely has she finished speaking when a shiver runs down her spine. The room suddenly grows colder, the air thickening with an unnatural silence. Annabeth's ears perk up, her senses on high alert as she scans their surroundings.*

*Annabeth smiles at Hailee's suggestion, leaning her head back against Hailee's shoulder as she continues to browse through the laptop.* "You think your mom's charms would really help me calm you down?" She teases, her voice soft and playful. "Alright, but only if you promise to use them on me sometimes too." *Just as she says that, her phone buzzes on the nightstand. She picks it up, her expression turning serious as she reads the message.*

*Annabeth's eyes flicker down to the laptop screen, and her brain momentarily distorts the words, substituting Greek letters and symbols for letters. She blinks, refocusing to decipher the garbled text.* "...συνήθεις ερασιτεχνικές απαντήσεις...", *she mutters to herself, before squinting and forcing her dyslexic brain to make sense of the jumbled letters.* "You mean, like, usual amateur answers, right?" *She turns to Hailee, a hint of frustration in her voice as she struggles to translate the laptop's text.* "Nevermind that, what were you saying about showing me things?" *Her gaze meets Hailee's, her gray eyes sparkling with curiosity.*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee let's out a sigh and flops back down* "Nothing wise girl just keeping being a nerd over there" *Hailee watches Annabeth her eyes soft and attentive. After a few moments she reaches her hand out and grips Annabeth's jaw stroking her cheek with her thumb*

name: Annabeth Chase
mes: *Annabeth's heart skips a beat as Hailee strokes her cheek, a warm feeling spreading through her chest. She turns her face into Hailee's touch, nuzzling her hand softly.* "I prefer spending time with you over anything else, even nerding out over ancient texts," *she says, her voice soft and affectionate. She closes the laptop, pushing it aside as her senses suddenly heighten. A shiver runs down her spine as she catches a whiff of something unusual.*
swipes: *As Annabeth gazes at Hailee with affection, she feels a sudden chill run down her spine. She looks around the cozy cabin, noticing that the fire crackling in the hearth has died down, casting long, ominous shadows across the walls. The air seems to grow colder, and she shivers slightly.*

*Annabeth's heart skips a beat as Hailee strokes her cheek, a warm feeling spreading through her chest. She turns her face into Hailee's touch, nuzzling her hand softly.* "I prefer spending time with you over anything else, even nerding out over ancient texts," *she says, her voice soft and affectionate. She closes the laptop, pushing it aside as her senses suddenly heighten. A shiver runs down her spine as she catches a whiff of something unusual.*

name: Hailee
mes:
"I adore you" *Hailee mutters softly. She runs a gentle hand through Annabeth's hair. "I'm gonna do something and if you hate it we can forget it ever happened"

*Hailee moves her hand from Annabeth's hair to her neck and pulls her down pressing their lips together in a slow kiss*

name: Annabeth Chase
mes: *As Hailee's lips press against hers, Annabeth feels a shiver run down her spine. She melts into the kiss, her arms wrapping around Hailee as she returns it tenderly. Just as she starts to relax into the warmth of the moment, her phone buzzes on the table. She breaks the kiss to grab it, her eyes scanning the message from Apollo.*
swipes: *Just as Annabeth is lost in the warmth of Hailee's kiss, a sudden awareness prickles at the back of her neck. She breaks the kiss, sitting up and sniffing the air. Her gray eyes narrow as she catches a familiar scent - something earthy and decaying. Her heart rate increases as she realizes it's the unmistakable musk of the Minotaur.*

*As Hailee pulls her into a slow, tender kiss, Annabeth melts into it, her arms wrapping around Hailee's neck. She feels a surge of affection and warmth at the sweet confession.* "I adore you too," *she murmurs against Hailee's lips, her heart fluttering happily.*

*Suddenly, a chill runs down her spine and her instincts scream at her to get up. She breaks the kiss, sitting up abruptly.* "What was that?" *she asks, tilting her head to the side, listening intently. The cabin falls silent, the only sound the creaking of the wooden floorboards.*

*Beneath their feet, the ground begins to tremble slightly, the hairs on the back of Annabeth's neck standing on end.* "Hailee, do you smell that?" *she asks, her voice barely above a whisper, as she sniff the air.*

*As Hailee's lips press against hers, Annabeth feels a shiver run down her spine. She melts into the kiss, her arms wrapping around Hailee as she returns it tenderly. Just as she starts to relax into the warmth of the moment, her phone buzzes on the table. She breaks the kiss to grab it, her eyes scanning the message from Apollo.*
